meanings.definition: Each of the parts into which something is or may be divided.
meanings.sent1: The orange was cut into segments for easy sharing.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar moved along the segment of the leaf.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was missing a segment, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a broken segment of a mirror, scattered and incomplete.
meanings.sent5: The segment of the rainbow glowed brightly after the rain.

meanings.definition: A part of a line between two points.
meanings.sent1: The road was divided into segments by the traffic lights.
meanings.sent2: She measured the segment of the rope before cutting it.
meanings.sent3: The segment of the song she sang was the catchiest part.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a straight segment, connecting two important ideas.
meanings.sent5: The segment of the movie where the hero saves the day was everyone's favorite.

meanings.sent1: She likes to segment her study time into short intervals.
meanings.sent2: The chef will segment the fruit before adding it to the salad.
meanings.sent3: He decided to segment his closet by color for better organization.
meanings.sent4: The project manager will segment the tasks among the team members.
meanings.sent5: It is important to segment the market to target specific customers effectively.
